com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel
Class HandGuidingMotion

java.lang.Object
  com.kuka.roboticsAPI.commandModel.Action<T>
      com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.Motion<HandGuidingMotion>
          com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.HandGuidingMotion
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.kuka.roboticsAPI.commandModel.IAction, com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.IKROSMotion, com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.IMotion, com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.IParameterizable
public final class HandGuidingMotion
extends com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.Motion<HandGuidingMotion>
implements com.kuka.roboticsAPI.motionModel.IKROSMotion

Using the Handguiding motion command will bring the robot into a mode, which enables it to be moved by the handguiding device. When the switch on the handguiding device is pressed, the robot can be moved by grasping it, when it is released, the handguiding motion ends.

This element is not in its final state and might change in future versions.

Constructor Summary
HandGuidingMotion()
          Creates a new HandGuidingMotion with the default hand guiding control mode.

getAxisLimitsMin

public double[] getAxisLimitsMin()
Get axis limits during handguiding motion in negative direction. The returned value may be null, if no user-specified axis limits in negative direction have been set yet.

Returns:
Axis limits in negative direction in radians.

getAxisLimitsEnabled

public boolean[] getAxisLimitsEnabled()
Get whether user-specified axis limits during handguiding motion are enabled. The returned value may be null, if the user has not enabled or disabled specific axes yet.

Returns:
True, if n-th axis limits (limits in both positive and negative direction) are enabled, and false otherwise.

setAxisLimitsEnabled

public HandGuidingMotion setAxisLimitsEnabled(boolean... axisLimitsEnabled)
Set whether user-specified axis limits during handguiding motion are enabled.

Parameters:
axisLimitsEnabled - True, if n-th axis limits (limits in both positive and negative direction) are enabled, and false otherwise.
Returns:
A copy of this object (builder pattern).

validateAxisLimits

public void validateAxisLimits(int arrayLengthRequired)
Check if configured axis limits are consistent, and throw an IllegalArgumentException otherwise.

Parameters:
arrayLengthRequired - Required length of arrays, if arrays are configured.

isAxisLimitViolationFreezesAll

public boolean isAxisLimitViolationFreezesAll()
Get whether on axis limit violation all axes should be frozen.

Returns:
True, if on axis limit violation all axes should be frozen, and false for freezing of only violating axes.

setAxisLimitViolationFreezesAll

public HandGuidingMotion setAxisLimitViolationFreezesAll(boolean freezeAllAxesOnViolation)
Set whether on axis limit violation all axes should be frozen. If this value is not set, it defaults to true.

Parameters:
freezeAllAxesOnViolation - True, if on axis limit violation all axes should be frozen, and false for freezing of only violating axes.
Returns:
A copy of this object (builder pattern).

isPermanentPullOnViolationAtStart

public boolean isPermanentPullOnViolationAtStart()
Get whether on axis limit violation at the start of the motion there is a permanent pull towards the axis limit.

Returns:
True, if on axis limit violation at the start of the motion there is a permanent pull towards the axis limit, false otherwise.

setPermanentPullOnViolationAtStart

public HandGuidingMotion setPermanentPullOnViolationAtStart(boolean permanentPullOnViolationAtStart)
Set whether on axis limit violation at the start of the motion there is a permanent pull towards the axis limit. If this value is not set, it defaults to false.

Parameters:
permanentPullOnViolationAtStart - True, if on axis limit violation at the start of the motion there is a permanent pull towards the axis limit, false otherwise.
Returns:
A copy of this object (builder pattern).
